group_1.textCenter: ...The Neo-Magius' plan is to use the loudspeakers@at the Kamihama Civic Center.

group_1.textRight: Did Iroha tell you that?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, she's heading to the Civic Center with@Yachiyo and the others.

group_1.textRight: That's pretty close to here. Should we go too?

group_1.textLeft: Nah, seems like they've got Promised Blood and@Mifuyu backin' them up already.
Let's do what we can for now.

group_1.textRight: But we haven't decided on what to do with@"Operation Friendship", have we?

group_1.textLeft: Well, right now we're just gatherin' people@to help out...

group_1.textRight: Yeah... That's basically all we've done, huh...

group_1.textLeft: To tell the truth, I wanna find a more effective way.
'Cause if we can reel Kanagi and Mitama in,
we've got a shot at stoppin' the Neo-Magius' plan...

group_1.textRight: Isn't it kind of a waste of time to get people@together if we don't do anything, though...?

group_1.textLeft: Eh? I mean, I guess...
...Momotan, what should we do?

group_1.textRight: Oh, s-sorry!
I wasn't trying to hurt your feelings...
I just wanted to make a suggestion if you@didn't have any ideas.

group_1.textLeft: You could've opened with that...
Is there anythin' we can do on short notice like this?

group_1.textRight: How about making a petition site?
It won't change the situation much,
but it'd be a great way to show our stance@on the subject.
I've been collecting signatures for a forest@protection program near my house.
We could even take it to the government office.@What do you think?

group_1.textLeft: We don't have time to hand this over to them@and wait for a response, though.

group_1.textRight: But we'll have statistics for the number of@people who support the cause,
and they can even leave comments, so it'll be easy@to see who supports it, right?

group_1.textLeft: Can we get the people we've gathered so far@to sign the petition too?

group_1.textRight: Maybe we can show Mitama and Kanagi
that people from the East and West are trying@to work together like this.

group_1.textLeft: There we go! Great idea!@You're a genius, Kaedetan!
It's around midnight, but I'm sure lots of folks@are still up and about.
I bet there's lots of students lookin' for info@on social media.
Let's get in touch with 'em as we make our@way east, prioritizin' the apartment complexes.

group_1.textRight: What do you think, Rena...?

group_1.textLeft: Why are you looking at me like that?@It's fine by me, you know...?
I already contacted Himika and some other@Magical Girls around here,
so I think we'll have lots of girls helping us out.
Thank you, Renatan!

group_1.textRight: I don't wanna fight...with those two either...

group_1.textLeft: Yeah!

group_1.narration: The old, long-standing problem@between the East and West...
@About how the East is a dangerous town full@of nasty people, and how the West treats@Easterners coldly and tries to drive them away.
We have different lives and cultures that@may not always mesh well together.@But is it really impossible for us to get along...?
Compared to the past, we've had an increase in@networking through social media and club activities.@Does anyone else feel uncomfortable with@the same old rhetoric they've seen or heard?
Talking to someone as normal, meeting up@with them offline, and being surprised to@learn that they're from the East or Westâ€•@I think we've all been there before.
And yet, for some reason, there's this strong@pressure from the older generations and@the society around us that makes it hard@to figure out what's true.
If any of you have experienced this, would you@be willing to support "Operation Friendship"?@We'd appreciate it if anyone who agrees@could sign the petition linked on this page.
We're starting up the "Student Conference@for the Future of Kamihama City".
This is a collective where studentsâ€•East or Westâ€•@who agree with us can come together and@talk about how to join hands.
If we can gather enough signatures,@we'll call upon the city itself,@so please help out.

group_1.textRight: Wow, the numbers are going up a little already.

group_1.textLeft: That's...a pretty impressive number of signatures...
I mean, don't you think it's starting to pick@up the pace?

group_1.textRight: I wonder if everyone's sharing this with people@they know and getting it out there?

group_1.textLeft: Touka and Nemu tried to get the word out about@Magical Girls, but no luck.
Guess you just never know, huh?
Hey, you're Nagitan's something-or-other!
Oh, what? Her younger brother, right?

group_1.textRight: Yeah. Are you guys friends of my sister's...?

group_1.textLeft: ...Friends...? That's kinda hard to say...

group_1.textRight: In a situation like this, let's just go with yes.

group_1.textLeft: Don't say "in a situation like this"... You're gonna@make things even more complicated...
A-anyway, uh, don't sweat it.@We're on good terms.

group_1.textRight: ...You think she's got anything to do with@all this stuff that's going on...?

group_1.textLeft: Wh-what makes you say that?

group_1.textRight: I actually got in a fight the other day and had@to get rushed to the hospital.
The reason being that I was mugged by a group@of guys from the West.
Ever since my big sis found out about that,@she's been acting different...
I tried to tell her not to get violent.@She's always been a stickler for self-control.
But then she just up and left like she was@about to blow a fuse...

group_1.textLeft: ...That could definitely be the reason why@Kanagi got so shaken up, eh...
It's gonna be okay, though. We'll bring her back!

group_1.textRight: ...Mikage.
This is gonna sound pathetic, but I have@no idea what's going on...
So if you've got a better clue, I'd really appreciate it...

group_1.textLeft: Leave it to me!
